Reviews.Title: “Good Motel, shame about the area”
Reviews.Author: Dominique H
Reviews.Content: Being a student and attending a conference at the J.W Marriott, this motel was a fantastic price within walking distance of the conference and LA Live, as well as a Metro station. The rooms were cleaned every day and the place was spotless, the only problem with our rooms was the lack of a wardrobe and there were no coffee making facilities. However, for the price that we paid (a twin room worked out at roughly £240 for 7 nights) and for the little time that we were planning to stay it was perfect. Our only issue was the area. We were warned countless number of times by taxi drivers that the area we were staying in was really bad. We were warned to stay away from the park (MacArthur Park) and not to walk alone especially at night, when we were told not to go out at all. This was backed up by any locals that we spoke to. There are a lot of homeless in that area and people trying to sell fake ID. Occasionally we did have to walk back to the motel from LA Live and it felt a very threatening place to be at night, however, if you are willing to take taxis everywhere then it is a very reasonably priced place to stay. I wouldn't recommend this for families, but if you are travelling on your own, are not planning to spend much time in the motel and are looking for a base for a few days that is cheap, then this place is just right

Reviews.Title: “ok, but beware!”
Reviews.Author: George_stayed_here
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms on one reservation. Front desk clerk only held one room. Tried to tell me my reservation was not valid because it was "edited". (I had changed the reservation online, but had a valid printout and online verification showing two rooms.) The only two rooms available were one of the two that I had reserved, and the jacuzzi suite. Clerk told me jacuzzi suite was very expensive and thus unavailable. After threatening to go and stay with a friend, thus nullifying both rooms' reservations, the clerk relented and gave me the jacuzzi suite. Still charged an extra $10 though. I thanked him and told him I'd give them a "good review". My definition of "good" is 3 stars, though they deserve zero stars for the incompetence of whomever was responsible for losing the second room on my reservation. Rooms were above average w/rspct to amenities and cleanliness. Kids throwing football in parking lot hit my brand new car. Lady smoking joint on balcony near our room. Neighborhood is somewhat "sketchy". Would not want to walk at night. Hotel is arranged like a walled compound (to keep some of the bad elements out)? If you must stay near downtown or Koreatown on a budget, this place is okay (just stay inside).

Reviews.Title: “By all means avoid this sewer!!!”
Reviews.Author: jfenn12
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that I would have felt better sleeping on a park bench in east LA with the gangs than this place. Absolutely disgusting people here. Rooms were filthy. We had to wear shoes to keep our feet from carpet. There was so much dirt on the carpet you could scrape it off....Not worth it to stay here even if they would have paid us to stay there. There are bums on the street all around this hotel and sirens and screaming all night long. Whoever you have hired to work behind the bullet proof plexiglass they call an office should be fired asap. The most rude people I have ever dealt with in the service industry. A word to management would be to sell this place before one of your customers gets seriously sick or killed while staying here.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE PLACE”
Reviews.Author: daytripperSoCal
Reviews.Content: This is easily the WORST motel I've ever stayed at...the Indian management (especially the female that works in the afternoon) is rude and doesn't care about their customers. My "non-smoking" room smelled of cigarettes, the lock on the door was broken, I saw rats in the parking lot, roaches in the room, numerous holes in the walls, stains all over the sheets, pillowcases, and towels, the toilet wasn't flushing properly, and the tv only gets about 10 stations, with most of them in spanish. When I called the front desk to report any problems, they basically told me that it's not their problem, and refused to move me to another room. There is a sign when you check in that states NO REFUNDS, so the owner does give a s--t about you after taking your money. Although the property is within walking distance to the convention center, the area is very sketchy at night. There seemed to be plenty of budget accomodations in the area, so my recommendation is to AVOID THIS MOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place, great value”
Reviews.Author: rengelman
Reviews.Content: Other than a bit of traffic noise from busy nearby Alvarado Street (and a bit of radio sound from the next room, easily resolved when I asked about it), a very comfortable and enjoyable place to stay, convenient to Silver Lake, Sunset, Eagle Rock, etc. A nice (if a bit carbohydratey) breakfast every morning with coffee, OJ, danish, muffin and a free copy of the LA Times. Lots of nice morning sun on tables in an area outside the rooms. Great staff. Decent sized room with a walk-in closet, and acceptable bathroom. Very inexpensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Lyon45
Reviews.Content: Was a decent place for the money. Nice firm bed, fridge, good air conditioner. Free internet access, close to eating options.Some room lights didn't work, didn't come to change them after i asked. No where to hang clothes, no remote for TV, toilet was running all night. Parking is safe and it's fairly quiet. Great location for price.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, cheap hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: runawayvespa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet area but only a 5 minute walk to the 7th street subway station. The area seemed safe during the day, but we avoided going out after dark, as there were a lot of unsavory looking people loitering on the streets. The hotel staff were nice and helpful. The room was a decent size, with a flatscreen tv, fridge, microwave, desk and plenty of clothes storage space. The channel selection was limited, even though the hotel advertises cable and HBO. The sheet and underlay kept coming off the bed during the night, as they weren't fitted. This was annoying, but at least there was no sign of bedbugs. We were in a ground floor room and the noise of people in the room upstairs regularly woke us up. The smell of bleach in our room was overwhelming when we first arrived and it was hard to air out the room. Our bathroom was next to an alley that housed a few homeless people, so we were wary of opening the window. The breakfast selection looked bland and sugary. I took my own muesli into the dining room and no staff objected to that. The internet connection was poor inside the rooms and kept dropping out. I had to sit in the car, parked outside our room, to talk on skype. We had no trouble finding a free car park.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a cheap price”
Reviews.Author: jan20090
Reviews.Content: I loved this place!! After reading the reviews I was a bit apprehensive to stay here but I was pleasantly surprised. it had everything mentioned in the booking. a great comfortable bed, free wifi, free breakfast(although not that great or filling - coffee and danishes) . The only thing left to be desired was the absence of toileries in specific not toothpaste and shower cap. Although shampoo available and shower gel were provided. So on the whole I would give it a 4 on 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great Motel for the price”
Reviews.Author: JazAustralia
Reviews.Content: My partner and I arrived at this motel early morning after a long plane flight from Australia. Our room wasn't ready, but they stored our luggage and made every effort to prepare our room early. The room was ok, nothing special, but clean and good for the price. The motel is about 3 blocks from the Metro and is on the line to hollywood. We felt a little uncomfortable walking in this neighbourhood - it would have been great to have a car. Overall it was a pretty good experience and I don't think you'd get any place cheaper in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Do not ever book here unless you are brave enough to face the crap!”
Reviews.Author: JDFOSHO
Reviews.Content: Let me start with this comment...the America's best Value inn on 906 S Alvarado is the worst hotel I've stayed in and worst service I've received. Every time we had a question, we received very short "get out of my face soon" answers. We did not feel welcome at all. I made 2 reservations and plans changed to where i needed to come in 1 day earlier for our event. I called and it sounded as if they were previously asleep and did not want to speak to me because the phone rang for about 5 minutes. Upon arrival, they had switched only 1 of the rooms to the correct dates and although the parking lot was empty, they said "no rooms." Again, upon arrival, i had to ring the door bell multiple times for them to finally come to the front desk and received us with messed up hair, heigene, and blood shot eyes. SLEEPING! Then another man came out and said, "we have plenty of rooms." They put us in room 204 or whatever the last room top right of the building, and it smelled like urine BIG TIME, toilet did not flush, carpet was heavily soiled, Hair on the beds, tv stand was broken as if they were using it for parts, used soap in the bathroom, and numerous of other things! When we brought it to their attention, they said "ok" and simply hung up. I got really upset and went down stairs. By the time i got there, the man who said "we have many rooms" had keys to 2 rooms with kings. It was 4 of us so we needed rooms with 2 beds but this was somewhat accomodating considering what we had already saw and heard from the other man that was there! The next day, they gave us the room that we had originally reserved and had to move our stuff again. Beds were soo hard that sleeping on the floor with a sleeping bag felt a lot better. No shampoo at all. Bathroom was moldy and the rooms were very run down. Needless to say...we chose this location because it was convenient to the convention center. I don't know if America's Best Value Inn ever get QA inspections, but this facility DEFINITELY needs one soon considering the service received and the quality of the rooms. I will not book at this motel ever again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Barely Adequate”
Reviews.Author: lopezfam
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights--if there was the advertised wireless internet access we would have forfeited our 2nd night and found someplace nicer. Killed 6 roaches. Bed rock hard. Had to pay prior to stay with "no refunds." Other guests (or residents) very noisy. Smoke detector/sprinkler stuffed with tissue (by previous guest maybe?) Pay a little more and go somewhere else.

HotelInfo.Name: Americas Best Value Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 906 S. Alvarado St., Los Angeles, CA 90006
